definition: to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: The unruly youths soon cleared off when they saw the policeman coming.
sentences.chinese: 這些瞎起鬨的青年看到警察來了就迅速溜掉。

sentences.english: The crowd hooted at the speaker.
No longer were his lectures greeted with sneers and catcalls.
sentences.chinese: 他的課不再遭到嘲諷和“噓噓”的起鬨聲。

sentences.english: They jeered the speaker off the stage .
sentences.chinese: 他們起鬨把演講人趕下臺。

sentences.english: creating disturbances in a public place, thus causing serious disorder in such place.
sentences.chinese: 在公共場所起鬨鬧事，造成公共場所秩序嚴重混亂的。

sentences.english: I heard some of the audience heckle me with loud whistles.
sentences.chinese: 那天，我聽到觀衆中有人大聲吹口哨向我起鬨。

sentences.english: The crowd began to barrack the visiting team.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆開始朝客隊喝彩起鬨。

sentences.english: He went to heckle at their meetings.
Heckling is disrespectful to the person wo is trying to talk.
sentences.chinese: 當別人要說話的時候起鬨是很無禮的。

sentences.english: Flank a few man kids in addition to exceed grams to all emulate to build a big rumpus.
sentences.chinese: 旁邊幾個男孩子除了邁克以外都跟着起鬨。

sentences.english: The heckler was ejected from the auditorium for creating a disturbance.
sentences.chinese: 起鬨搗蛋分子因製造騷亂被趕出禮堂。

definition: Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple
